maml:description.maml:para: Adds a trusted policy signer for a tenant in Azure Attestation.
The Add-AzAttestationPolicySigner cmdlet adds a trusted policy signer for a tenant in Azure Attestation.
Specifies the name of an attestation provider.
Specifies the resource group name of an attestation provider.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.

Specifies the RFC7519 JSON Web Token containing a claim named "maa-policyCertificate" whose value is an RFC7517 JSON Web Key which contains a new trusted signing key to add. The RFC7519 JWT must be signed with one of the existing trusted signing keys.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Specifies the ResourceID of an attestation provider.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.

Specifies the RFC7519 JSON Web Token containing a claim named "maa-policyCertificate" whose value is an RFC7517 JSON Web Key which contains a new trusted signing key to add. The RFC7519 JWT must be signed with one of the existing trusted signing keys.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.
Specifies the name of an attestation provider.
Specifies the resource group name of an attestation provider.
Specifies the ResourceID of an attestation provider.

Specifies the RFC7519 JSON Web Token containing a claim named "maa-policyCertificate" whose value is an RFC7517 JSON Web Key which contains a new trusted signing key to add. The RFC7519 JWT must be signed with one of the existing trusted signing keys.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> $trustedSigner = Get-Content -Path .\trusted.signer.txt PS C:\> Add-AzAttestationPolicySigner -Name pshtest -ResourceGroupName psh-test-rg -Signer $trustedSigner

dev:remarks.maml:para: Add a trusted signer for the Atteestation Provider named pshtest .

maml:description.maml:para: Gets an attestation.
The Get-AzAttestation cmdlet gets information about the attestation in a subscription.
Specifies the Location of the default attestation provider.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.
Specifies this is the request to a default attestation provider.
Attestation Name.
Specifies the name of the resource group associated with the attestation being queried.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.
Specifies the name of the ResourceID associated with the attestation being queried
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.
Specifies this is the request to a default attestation provider.
Specifies the Location of the default attestation provider.
Attestation Name.
Specifies the name of the resource group associated with the attestation being queried.
Specifies the name of the ResourceID associated with the attestation being queried

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Get-AzAttestation -Name pshtest -ResourceGroupName psh-test-rg Id : subscriptions/xxxxxxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxxxxxxxxxxx/resourceGroups/psh-test-rg/providers/Microsoft.Attestation/attestationProviders/pshtest Location : East US ResourceGroupName : psh-test-rg Name : pshtest Status : Ready TrustModel : AAD AttestUri : https://pshtest.us.attest.azure.net Tags : {Production, Example} TagsTable : Name Value ========== ===== Production False Example True

dev:remarks.maml:para: Get Attestation Provider pshtest in Resource Group psh-test-rg .

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> Get-AzAttestation -DefaultProvider Id : /providers/Microsoft.Attestation/attestationProviders/sharedeus2 Location : East US 2 ResourceGroupName : Name : sharedeus2 Status : Ready TrustModel : AAD AttestUri : https://sharedeus2.eus2.attest.azure.net Tags : TagsTable :
Id : /providers/Microsoft.Attestation/attestationProviders/sharedcus Location : Central US ResourceGroupName : Name : sharedcus Status : Ready TrustModel : AAD AttestUri : https://sharedcus.cus.attest.azure.net Tags : TagsTable :
Id : /providers/Microsoft.Attestation/attestationProviders/shareduks Location : UK South ResourceGroupName : Name : shareduks Status : Ready TrustModel : AAD AttestUri : https://shareduks.uks.attest.azure.net Tags : TagsTable :

dev:remarks.maml:para: Get all available Attestation Default Providers

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 3 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Get-AzAttestation -DefaultProvider -Location "East US 2" Id : /providers/Microsoft.Attestation/attestationProviders/sharedeus2 Location : East US 2 ResourceGroupName : Name : sharedeus2 Status : Ready TrustModel : AAD AttestUri : https://sharedeus2.eus2.attest.azure.net Tags : TagsTable :

dev:remarks.maml:para: Get Attestation Default Provider from Location East US 2

maml:description.maml:para: Gets the policy from a tenant in Azure Attestation.
The Get-AzAttestationPolicy cmdlet gets the policy from a tenant in Azure Attestation.
Specifies the Location of the default attestation provider.
Specifies this is the request to a default attestation provider.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.
Specifies a type of Trusted Execution Environment. We support four types of environment: SgxEnclave, OpenEnclave, CyResComponent and VBSEnclave.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Specifies a name of the tenant. This cmdlet gets the attestation policy for the tenant that this parameter specifies.
Specifies the resource group name of an attestation provider.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.
Specifies a type of Trusted Execution Environment. We support four types of environment: SgxEnclave, OpenEnclave, CyResComponent and VBSEnclave.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Specifies the ResourceID of an attestation provider.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.
Specifies a type of Trusted Execution Environment. We support four types of environment: SgxEnclave, OpenEnclave, CyResComponent and VBSEnclave.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.
Specifies this is the request to a default attestation provider.
Specifies the Location of the default attestation provider.
Specifies a name of the tenant. This cmdlet gets the attestation policy for the tenant that this parameter specifies.
Specifies the resource group name of an attestation provider.
Specifies the ResourceID of an attestation provider.
Specifies a type of Trusted Execution Environment. We support four types of environment: SgxEnclave, OpenEnclave, CyResComponent and VBSEnclave.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------

dev:remarks.maml:para: Gets the policy for Attestation Provider pshtest for Tee type SgxEnclave .

dev:remarks.maml:para: Gets the trusted policy signers for the Attestation Provider pshtest in Resource Group psh-test-rg . Note that there are no trusted signers for this Attestation Provider.

maml:description.maml:para: Creates an attestation
The New-AzAttestation cmdlet creates an attestation in the specified resource group.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.
Specifies the Azure region in which to create the attestation provider. Use the command Get-AzResourceProvider with the ProviderNamespace parameter to see your choices.
Specifies a name of the Instance to create. The name can be any combination of letters, digits, or hyphens. The name must start and end with a letter or digit. The name must be universally unique.
Specifies the set of trusted signing keys for issuance policy in a single certificate file.
Specifies the name of an existing resource group in which to create the attestation.
A hash table which represents resource tags.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.
Specifies the Azure region in which to create the attestation provider. Use the command Get-AzResourceProvider with the ProviderNamespace parameter to see your choices.
Specifies a name of the Instance to create. The name can be any combination of letters, digits, or hyphens. The name must start and end with a letter or digit. The name must be universally unique.
Specifies the set of trusted signing keys for issuance policy in a single certificate file.
Specifies the name of an existing resource group in which to create the attestation.
A hash table which represents resource tags.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> New-AzAttestation -Name pshtest4 -ResourceGroupName psh-test-rg -Location "East US" -Tags @{Test="true";CreationYear="2020"} Id : subscriptions/xxxxxxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxxxxxxxxxxx/resourceGroups/psh-test-rg/providers/Microsoft.Attestation/attestationProviders/pshtest4 Location : East US ResourceGroupName : psh-test-rg Name : pshtest4 Status : Ready TrustModel : AAD AttestUri : https://pshtest4.us.attest.azure.net Tags : {CreationYear, Test} TagsTable : Name Value ============ ===== CreationYear 2020 Test true

dev:remarks.maml:para: Create a new instance of an Attestation Provider named pshtest4 with a couple tags and using AAD trust for mastering TEE policy.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> New-AzAttestation -Name pshtest3 -ResourceGroupName psh-test-rg -Location "East US" -PolicySignersCertificateFile .\cert1.pem Id : subscriptions/xxxxxxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxxxxxxxxxxx/resourceGroups/psh-test-rg/providers/Microsoft.Attestation/attestationProviders/pshtest3 Location : East US ResourceGroupName : psh-test-rg Name : pshtest3 Status : Ready TrustModel : Isolated AttestUri : https://pshtest3.us.attest.azure.net Tags : TagsTable :

dev:remarks.maml:para: Create a new instance of an Attestation Provider named pshtest3 ` that uses Isoladed trust for mastering TEE policy via specifying a set of trusted signing keys via a PEM file.

The Remove-AzAttestationPolicySigner cmdlet removes a trusted policy signer for a tenant in Azure Attestation.

The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.

Specifies the RFC7519 JSON Web Token containing a claim named "maa-policyCertificate" whose value is an RFC7517 JSON Web Key which contains a trusted signing key to remove. The RFC7519 JWT must be signed with one of the existing trusted signing keys.

command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> $trustedSigner = Get-Content -Path .\trusted.signer.txt PS C:\> Remove-AzAttestationPolicySigner -Name pshtest -ResourceGroupName psh-test-rg -Signer $trustedSigner

dev:remarks.maml:para: Remove a trusted signer for the Attestation Provider named pshtest .

maml:description.maml:para: Resets the policy from a tenant in Azure Attestationn.}
The Reset-AzAttestationPolicy cmdlet resets the user defined attestation policy from a tenant in Azure Attestation.
Specifies a name of the tenant. This cmdlet resets the attestation policy for the tenant that this parameter specifies.
Specifies the resource group name of an attestation provider.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.
This Cmdlet does not return an object by default. If this switch is specified, it returns true if successful.
Specifies the JSON Web Token describing the policy document to reset.
Specifies a type of Trusted Execution Environment. We support four types of environment: SgxEnclave, OpenEnclave, CyResComponent and VBSEnclave.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Specifies the ResourceID of an attestation provider.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.
This Cmdlet does not return an object by default. If this switch is specified, it returns true if successful.
Specifies the JSON Web Token describing the policy document to reset.
Specifies a type of Trusted Execution Environment. We support four types of environment: SgxEnclave, OpenEnclave, CyResComponent and VBSEnclave.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.
Specifies a name of the tenant. This cmdlet resets the attestation policy for the tenant that this parameter specifies.
This Cmdlet does not return an object by default. If this switch is specified, it returns true if successful.
Specifies the JSON Web Token describing the policy document to reset.
Specifies the resource group name of an attestation provider.
Specifies the ResourceID of an attestation provider.
Specifies a type of Trusted Execution Environment. We support four types of environment: SgxEnclave, OpenEnclave, CyResComponent and VBSEnclave.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Reset-AzAttestationPolicy -Name pshtest -ResourceGroupName psh-test-rg -Tee SgxEnclave

dev:remarks.maml:para: Reset the policy to the default for the Attestation Provider pshtest for Tee type SgxEnclave .

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> $resetJwt = Get-Content -Path .\reset.policy.txt.signed.txt PS C:\> Reset-AzAttestationPolicy -Name pshtest -ResourceGroupName psh-test-rg -Tee SgxEnclave -Policy $resetJwt

dev:remarks.maml:para: If the Attestation Provider pshtest is configured to use the isolated trust model, reset the policy to the default for Tee type SgxEnclave by including a signed policy.

maml:description.maml:para: Sets the policy from a tenant in Azure Attestationn.
The Set-AzAttestationPolicy cmdlet sets the policy from a tenant in Azure Attestation.
Specifies a name of the tenant. This cmdlet sets the attestation policy for the tenant that this parameter specifies.
Specifies the resource group name of an attestation provider.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.
This Cmdlet does not return an object by default. If this switch is specified, it returns true if successful.
Specifies the policy document to set. The policy format can be either Text or JSON Web Token (JWT).
Specifies the format for the policy, either Text or JWT (JSON Web Token). The default policy format is Text.
Specifies a type of Trusted Execution Environment. Four types of environment are supported: SgxEnclave, OpenEnclave, CyResComponent and VBSEnclave.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Specifies the ResourceID of an attestation provider.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.
This Cmdlet does not return an object by default. If this switch is specified, it returns true if successful.
Specifies the policy document to set. The policy format can be either Text or JSON Web Token (JWT).
Specifies the format for the policy, either Text or JWT (JSON Web Token). The default policy format is Text.
Specifies a type of Trusted Execution Environment. Four types of environment are supported: SgxEnclave, OpenEnclave, CyResComponent and VBSEnclave.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.
Specifies a name of the tenant. This cmdlet sets the attestation policy for the tenant that this parameter specifies.
This Cmdlet does not return an object by default. If this switch is specified, it returns true if successful.
Specifies the policy document to set. The policy format can be either Text or JSON Web Token (JWT).
Specifies the format for the policy, either Text or JWT (JSON Web Token). The default policy format is Text.
Specifies the resource group name of an attestation provider.
Specifies the ResourceID of an attestation provider.
Specifies a type of Trusted Execution Environment. Four types of environment are supported: SgxEnclave, OpenEnclave, CyResComponent and VBSEnclave.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> $policy = Get-Content -Path .\custom.sgx.policy.txt PS C:\> Set-AzAttestationPolicy -Name pshtest -ResourceGroupName psh-test-rg -Tee SgxEnclave -Policy $policy

dev:remarks.maml:para: Sets the user defined policy for TEE type SgxEnclave for Attestation Provider pshtest using a text policy format (default).

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> $policyjwt = Get-Content -Path .\custom.sgx.policy.jwt.format.txt PS C:\> Set-AzAttestationPolicy -Name pshtest -ResourceGroupName psh-test-rg -Tee SgxEnclave -Policy $policyjwt -PolicyFormat JWT

dev:remarks.maml:para: Sets the user defined policy for TEE type SgxEnclave for Attestation Provider pshtest using a JWT policy format.
